lenders.name: Julius John
lenders.whereabouts: Cagayan de Oro City Misamis Oriental
lenders.loan_because:
Hello everyone, Im Julius from the philippines and ive been to college for 7 years, Im good in math and a computer literate. I graduate at march 2005 and my course is BS-Electronics and Communications Engineering thats why i stayed long in college maybe im not that smart. But i believe that hardwork surpasses genuis, this phrase keeps telling me that giving up is not an option. Finally I graduated, yet Parents' whining is not yet over. My next goal is to pass the Board exam to be a licensed ece engineer. It's the hardest part of my life since im not really that smart especially reading lots of books because we Filipinos have different language. I failed my  first take on my board exam, my parents were so angry, but still they have hope in me then given me a chance for the second time, and still i failed, and i tot it is the end of the world, luckily my parents have positive attitude toward it because what they saw was that my average score improved from 64% to 68% because the average passing grade is 70%. I was so depressed and i tot will not gonna make it, maybe i need more motivation and here comes another problem that came before i took my 3rd time board exam. My girlfriend is 2 months pregnant and i have 2 months left to study and review b4 my 3rd take of board exam starts. I keep it secret to my parents, now that i have one problem i always thought what will happen if i fail and they know that my girlfriend is pregnant, i need to come up with a good solution to this problem, i slept 6 hours a day for me to have lots of study time and i dedicated my life on studying just to pass the board exam and i always thought what future i could give to my baby if i wont make it this time and what would my parents do to me. Im so scared and pressured and my parents always reminding me that im 26 and still worthless. I never stop believing in God and myself, i feel that i can make it. Thanks to God my younger brother woke us up 2am in the morning at april 2007 to announce that i passed the board exam, my parents were so happy that they cant even wait to buy a news paper, yet i was so uncomfortable with the environment because cos i still have to confess to them that my gf is pregnant. Same that day at 6pm i approached my mom and said my girlfriend is pregnant. My parents both cried, they told me that you even did not let this day of hapiness passed. I gave them hapiness in the morning and sadness in the evening. I feel very sorry for what did. But sadness were paid of when my baby andrea came out, she's very cute and healhty yet hospital bills were P45,000 or $1,100 when it's converted to USD. I owe that to my parents since i dont have a job. I found a job after 7 months with a P8,000 salary or $200 per month which is enough only for one person so ill have to budget it just to fit for the three of us. My girlfriend is stil in school so im the one responsible for the expenses of my baby and even to some of her needs. I saved money during my 2 mos of work and i used it to baptizm of my baby last dec30. Right now im saving for our wedding which i think i need a long time for me to save enough for marriage. Before we use to own an internet cafe for 5 yrs yet technology rise faster and our computer cant catch up new games specificaition and new policies were implemented that all internet cafe must have a license on all of their software. We were busy that time. Cafe just last from 2001 to 2005 only. Maybe it's one of the reasons why i get low grades. And my parents wanted to close it to focus on my board exam. My parent's plan went well that why i passed the board exam. I always think also to help some street children here in our country but dont have the money to do that. All i can give is give my old clothes. If i come up with this $10,000 USD or more ill restore our internet cafe. Im fully equiped with knowledge on running this internet cafe yet dont have a capital to start the business. Im asking everyone to help me achieve my goal to give my family a better future and to help street children in our country as well. Id be willing to share my blessing to those who need it the most. I would love to be used as an instrument to help others as well. 
Here is my paypal account: juliusgatinao@yahoo.com
Help me make my dream come true.
I hope those who have enough blessings may share it with me. Thank you and God Bless you. 
About me: I work as a technical support staff in a business company who sells routers, switches, computers and other high end telecomunication products. Right now im planing to run a business to change my life and help others. I can do offline typing jobs for you just to raise this fund. Hard to find better job here in the Philippines.
lenders.occupational_info: I work as a technical support staff in a business company who sells routers, switches, computers and other high end telecomunication products. Right now im planing to run a business to change my life and help others.

That's what KIVA means to me!

lenders.loan_because: I think that if somebody is bold enough to ask for a loan in this fashion, then they actually have the drive to make their dreams a reality, and I want to help.

lenders.name: Christina
lenders.loan_because: ... I believe micro-credit loans are a successful means of preventing human trafficking.
lenders.occupational_info:
My colleagues and I work primarily in the Washington, DC area and in Southeast Asia to promote programs that are addressing the root causes of human trafficking, and to provide sustainable alternatives.

We have financed many micro-credit loans for women and men in Thailand who want to start their own businesses as an alternative way to make a living for their families so that they're not circumstantially forced to take work that would be degrading or demeaning to them.

lenders.name: Jennifer
lenders.loan_because: I want to help other people get the start they need to succeed.

lenders.name: Petra Reneyvo
lenders.loan_because: I need more fund to expand my computer business in my CyberCAFE in Tomohon, North Sulawesi - Indonesia.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an Indonesia Male, age 33, married, and have 4 children. I live in a beautifull City called Tomohon in North Sulawesi, Indonesia. Since 1996, what I do for living are to service people for their computer needs (consulting, programming and troubleshooting in Personal Computers, Notebooks and Local Area Network. Because the growing of internet in my area is very fast, I open a internet cafe since December 2006. In my business (CyberCAFE Tomohon), I rent computer to people, who use computer for browsing, chatting, gaming or work. Right now, I have 10 computer client and 1 server. The service are for 24 hours, except for Sunday or Holiday. I planned to add more computer to my CyberCAFE and if possible, I want to open a computer store and services.
